Dendron

page-type Topic

A VS Code extension to collect and organize notes.

Even though it‚Äôs technically in maintenance mode now, it‚Äôs still a handy PKM to run from inside VS Code. Plus it‚Äôs under Apache license if anyone wants to fork it.

Workflow

I don‚Äôt really have one. But here are some things I keep in mind.

Dendron supports the Amoeba pattern

Write big note

extract small note via selection

select text

click bulb üí° icon

select refactor text to new note

hierarchy refactoring

schemas

hierarchical graphs

Dendron refactoring commands:

Refactoring

Dendron: Rename Note

moves note to new location in hierarchy

updates backlinks to new location

Dendron: Refactor Hierarchy

updates multiple hierarchy pages via regular expressions

How I generally use Dendron

Not a formal process ‚Äî trying to identify and improve my flow. Tweaked slightly as these days I use this vault for the stuff I don‚Äôt mind people seeing, and other tools for work and other such sensitive bits.

first stop is always C-S-i for the daily journal note

my journal isn‚Äôt really a ‚Äú5 minute‚Äù or bujo; more of a ‚ÄúWTF is happening‚Äù

borrowing taxonomy, it‚Äôs where I put my fleeting notes

when I have a concept I think should be a node, I decide where it goes and link + C-<click> to add with summary and a resource link if handy

How I‚Äôd like to use Dendron

first stop remains the daily note in my journal

the day‚Äôs tasks get added as task notes

when I have a chunk or section that makes the journal note feel cumbersome, extract it to a scratch note.

periodically refactor scratch nodes into the schema ierarchy, either as new chunks in existing notes or as new notes

Command: Dendron: Configure (YAML)

use the command ‚Äî stop looking in your workspace for the YAML file

Synchronization

Sync section in Best Practices

Dendron: Workspace: Sync manually synchronizes with reop (commit, pull, push)

when you get tired of that, set up VS Code GitDoc

Fiddly Customization

Ctrl+Enter should open note under the cursor

At some point C-ENTER stopped opening notes in Dendron. My own fault, I‚Äôm sure. But I figured it out! Fiddled with the where property of VS Code binding for Dendron: Go to Note:

editorFocus && resourceExtName == '.md'

Task Notes

Tasks

Not as polished as Taskwarrior or Org mode, but more useful than your basic checkboxes.

Commands

Dendron: Create Task Note

Dendron: Set Task Status

Dendron: Complete Task

Config

 
workspace:
    task:
        name: task
        dateFormat: y.MM.dd
        addBehavior: asOwnDomain
        statusSymbols:
            later: ' '
            now: '/'
            wait: '?'
            done: x
            nah: '-'
        taskCompleteStatus:
            - done
            - x
            - nah
        prioritySymbols:
            H: high
            M: medium
            L: low
        todoIntegration: false
        createTaskSelectionType: selection2link

Todo Tree Integration

Integrates with VS Code Todo Tree

If you enable workspace.task.todoIntegration, then Dendron adds a frontmatter item TODO: TASK TITLE on task creation. Since it already has task-specific frontmatter, I opted to tweak workspace settings for Todo Tree instead.

{
    "settings": {
        "todo-tree.general.tags": [
            "FIXME",
            "TODO",
            "XXX",
            "[ ]",
            "[/]",
            "[?]",
            "[x]",
            "[-]",
            "status: ''",
            "status: x",
            "status: later",
            "status: now",
            "status: wait",
            "status: done",
            "status: nah"
        ],
        "todo-tree.general.tagGroups": {
            "NOW": ["[/]", "status: now"],
            "LATER": ["[ ]", "status: ''", "TODO", "FIXME", "XXX"],
            "WAIT": ["[?]", "status: wait"],
            "DONE": ["[x]", "status: done"],
            "NAH": ["status: nah"]
        },
    }
}

The tree is still a little iffy about grouped views, but that‚Äôs probably a config thing for me to figure out rather than a bug.
